Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2013 02:36PM Fiddledeedee wrote: Thanks everyone for your experiences and support. And Tuffenough I send you the most heartfelt concerns and support . Missing a wedding is a Big Deal. This S.... Sure does get in the way of LIFE Mama I agree. There are no parts like our own parts. And I think I'm OK with "just" a lumpectomy. I think I'm mostly upset with how much time this will be taking out of my life.(besides the waiting and not knowing)...not looking forward to recovery, Rads and then continued follow up. Life is short and seems to be getting shorter ;-). But then I need to be present every day and realize none of us are really in control.....we just think or pretend we are. I'm trying to think of this as a chronic disease. Something that will need to be managed for the rest of my life. Every day really is a gift...The Present. And I don't want to waste too much Thanks and good wishes to all of you on this board. Even though I haven't written much the majority of everyone here gives me hope and makes me feel that I am not crazy for the roller coaster emotions. Even for such a benign thing like the PreOp vist
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2013 03:10PM Fiddledeedee wrote: Hi everyone Had my surgery yesterday. Hard time waking up in post op but no other problems. I was scared re wire placement because my tumor is very sensitive. But it wasn't bad at all. The radiologist and US tech were great. In fact the entire crew was great. And being in health care myself I'm fussy. Today I'm at home lying around, a bit wobbly on my feet but able to navigate. Slept like a log last night. Still tender mostly at the node sites but taking Tylenol even though I have Vicodin. Surprisingly I feel emotionally much better. The tumor was small. 1.4 cm. and mixed lobar ductal grade 2 but I feel good about doing a lumpectomy. Statistics can be a skewed at worse but I still felt there was no advantage to doing a mastectomy. Still waiting on the final path report...1 node lit up and 2 small clumps were faint so will wait until the 13th ( yep that's Friday) for final results. Thanks for the support I got from here. I felt like the worst part is the mental "what if what if what if". And reading here helped me Hope this helps the next steps for someone.....
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2013 10:26PM Fiddledeedee wrote: Beatrice......I was the same way. Hard time falling asleep then woke uo several times during the night. Made for bad days....pissy, moody, lack of concentration. Finally called my PCP and asked for some loazapam. I must have sounded awful! He gave me 60!!! Probably enough for a life time. Anyway...1/2 tab at bedtime Really helped me. I'm not much for drugs, but waiting until the 30th is a mightily long time. Mom1 2 1. I'm sorry you are back to this list, but glad you thought it was worthwhile enough to return. I came across this group accidentally trying to piece together what it all meant. Still don't have all the answers but found the voices here gave me something that can't be described in words. Peacestrength. I had ULX w SNB on the 5th. I count myself very fortunate ...no drains and I TOOK A SHOWER TODAY. Talk about pampering...I even washed my hair! Good wishes for best results for our other September sisters.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2013 06:27PM Fiddledeedee wrote: Hi. Mostly I've been a lurker, trying to piece together what's what. Birthday surprise at 65 diagnosed with IMC. Scheduled for wire placement, LX with SNB on Sept 3. Not sleeping well but still going to work and trying to function the best I can. Being in the health care profession has helped and hindered as I go through the What Ifs (fill in the blanks). Not sure i have much to offer anyone here except well wishes and some empathy. So add my name to the list
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2013 12:50PM Fiddledeedee wrote: Glad to hear 2 of us made it through ;-) I go tomorrow.....not worried about the surgery...mostly about the compression part. I know I can make it through 2 min but an hour!? YIKES Here's to a short waiting time until the Final Report card. I trust my surgeon very much. So I'm holding my chin up and taking a loazapam before bed tonight HA Best and easiest recoveries to all.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2013 03:45PM Fiddledeedee wrote: Just got back from Pre-op visit. Very upsetting to me to talk to people I don't know re: my health and my diagnosis. As soon as you say breast cancer people say weird things. One of them had to tell me about how she insisted on a BMX so she would be cured, but only because she was so aggressive in her insistence did her surgeon finally give in. And now she doesn't worry any more. What? Am I missing something here? I'm usually level headed and cheerful. This whole thing would be much better for me if I didn't keep getting advice from others.....but they would just listening IF I wanted to talk about IT. the closer it gets the less patience I have. I usually walk and work in my studio doing wet felting, preparing fleece, dyeing, and other fiber activities to relax and destress. Today I want to sit on the couch. I haven't had a good night's sleep since my diagnosis....keep walking up 2 or more times a night. I'm sure that has something to do with my attitude. Sorry to rant. But I'm thinking this group Gets It. Best wishes to you all during The Wait.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2013 11:36PM Fiddledeedee wrote: Peace strength ... I hope you are resting and napping and feeling better every day. My wishes for a steady recovery Tuffenuff...so happy to hear you'll be able to attend the wedding and your surgery went so well Hobbesla sorry to hear about re excision. It's hard not going forward steadily, even at a snails pace. Hoping you find value in every day as you heal. Summergal ...Anxiety is an awful monster in this battle. I honor the place of love, light, truth and peace within you. I hope you find it strong within you Sandymomto3. Hope your path report brings no new surprises. Mamasixtaz....do something really nice for yourself. A wonderful distraction. I'm thinking it doesn't get any easier with every surgery. My ULX was on 9/5 but I won't get results re anything until 9/13. I am practicing developing more patience than I ever thought I could. My post op phone call was "surgery went well, SN and 2 other small clumps were blue so i took them also". Nothing about any predictions. I felt so much better after the surgery...now I'm on that roller coaster again....do I have clear margins? What does having blue nodes mean? Are they positive? I need to go practice saying. "Fiddle deedee". I'll get to that bridge eventually. Blessings and strength to those next in September surgery
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie
